main event: A disc-shaped object, approximately 15 feet in diameter, was observed on radar at an elevation of 45 degrees, traveling in a northeast direction at an altitude of around 6,000 feet. The object disappeared after approximately 3-5 minutes.
interesting points: The radar observation was confirmed by visual observation, and the military control tower confirmed that there were no planes in the area.
The observer had a security clearance.
The report indicates that there was 'noise' on the radar scope, suggesting insufficient data on this observation.
There were additional sightings of a 'bright light' in the Corvallis, Oregon area, with the object described as round, silver dollar-sized, and white in color.
The object was observed to hover momentarily and then zig-zag before disappearing behind the horizon.
sighted object: disc-shaped object, round/silver dollar-sized bright light
